intro: Campanula versicolor var. thessala, commonly known as the Thessalian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountains of Greece. It produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, depending on the soil pH. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring to early summer.
